subject: Art & Design
title: Fast Fashion: Speed, Scale, and Consequences
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Fast Fashion: Speed, Scale, and Consequences.

hook.text: Zara can go from design to store shelf in 15 days. Traditional fashion takes 6 months. Speed changed everything.

buildup.text: Fast fashion replicates runway trends quickly and cheaply: H&M, Zara, Shein.

discovery.text: It democratized fashion. Trendy clothes became affordable. But the human and environmental costs are staggering.

twist.text: The fashion industry produces 10% of global carbon emissions ‚Äî more than aviation and shipping combined.

climax.text: The Rana Plaza factory collapse (2013) killed 1,134 workers. It exposed the true cost of $5 t-shirts.

punchline.text: Fast fashion made clothes disposable. The planet is paying the price.

quiz.question: How quickly can Zara take a design from concept to store shelf?
options: About 15 days ‚Äî compared to 6 months for traditional fashion
About 6 months ‚Äî same as traditional fashion
About 2 years ‚Äî slower due to quality control
